The following technical training programs for audiology assistants are self-identified. These programs have not been reviewed or evaluated in any way by ASHA for technical training of audiology assistants. Placement on this list does not indicate any endorsement by ASHA.   Audiology AcademyPhone: 360-436-6376Email: info@AudiologyAcademy.com NOVA Southeastern UniversityAudiology Assistant Program3200 S. University DriveFt. Lauderdale, FL 33328Phone: 954-262-7745Email: audassist@nova.edu Georgia State UniversityAudiology Assistant Certificate ProgramProgram Director/Coordinator: Akilah Heggs, PhD, CCC-A30 Pryor Street SWAtlanta, GA 30303Phone: 404-413-8394/8343Email: audassistant@gsu.edu The American Speech-Language-Hearing Association (ASHA) is the national professional, scientific, and credentialing association for 228,000 members and affiliates who are audiologists; speech-language pathologists; speech, language, and hearing scientists; audiology and speech-language pathology support personnel; and students.
